page.title: 02LOCAL WORDS AND MEANINGS
page.content: In our area there are some words which are still used mainly by the older generation.{ {GRAMMAR:}munna = must not, canna =can not, shanna = shall not, wunna = will not, inna = is not, dunna = do not, anna = have not, udna = would not, bist = are you, summat = something, I ood = I would, yoom = you are. {FARMING:}stank = hedge stake, giss = geese, ship = sheep, scuffle = hoe, gaffer = boss, bruk = brook, troughin = guttering, sod = pool,mud, rick = haystack, tump = covered veetable store, mixen = manure heap. {AROUND THE HOME:}owd uman =old woman, kymit = stupid, insane, gawby = daft, wum = home, yed = head, fut = foot, ess 'ole = fireplace, clemmed = hungry, brivit = searching, punnd im = hit him, chimuk = chimney, chopsin = speaking, larrup = hit or drink
